p: Air-dried aerial parts (leaves and stem) of B. heterophylla (5 g) were extracted with 250 mL of boiling water for 30 min. The resulting infusion was filtrated and concentrated in vacuo to yield 1.28 g of dry aqueous extract (EA). On the order hand, the infusion was exhaustively partitioned with EtOAc (250 mL Ã— 3); the combined organic fractions were dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate and concentrated in vacuo to yield 0.116 g of dry ethyl acetate fraction. This process was repeated as much as needed to obtain 10 g of this fraction.
